en_first_half: When Mr. Lorry had finished his breakfast, he went out for a stroll on the beach. The little narrow, crooked town of Dover hid itself away from the beach, and ran its head into the chalk cliffs, like a marine ostrich. The beach was a desert of heaps of sea and stones tumbling wildly about, and the sea did what it liked, and what it liked was destruction. It thundered at the town, and thundered at the cliffs, and brought the coast down, madly. The air among the
en_second_half: houses was of so strong a piscatory flavour that one might have supposed sick fish went up to be dipped in it, as sick people went down to be dipped in the sea. A little fishing was done in the port, and a quantity of strolling about by night, and looking seaward: particularly at those times when the tide made, and was near flood. Small tradesmen, who did no business whatever, sometimes unaccountably realised large fortunes, and it was remarkable that nobody in the neighbourhood could endure a lamplighter.
vi_first_half: Sau khi dùng xong bữa điểm tâm, ông Lorry ra ngoài đi dạo trên bãi biển. Thành phố Dover quanh co, chật hẹp, nhỏ bé náu mình cách xa bờ, một đầu đâm thẳng ra dãy vách núi đá vôi như con đà điểu cắm đầu xuống biển. Bãi hoang vắng chỉ có những đợt sóng quăng quật đá lăn tứ tung; biển chỉ làm điều nó thích và ý thích đó là hủy diệt. Biển giáng sấm sét xuống thành phố, giáng sấm sét lên các vách núi, và điên cuồng nện sóng vào bờ. Bầu không khí giữa các ngôi nhà tanh nồng tới

Ít ai đánh cá ở cảng này, nhưng ban đêm có rất nhiều kẻ lảng vảng quanh đây và nhìn ra biển - đặc biệt vào những lúc thủy triều lớn và gần ngập lụt. es_first_half: Terminado el almuerzo, el señor Lorry salió a dar un paseíto por la playa. No se divisaba desde ella la pequeña e irregular ciudad de Dover, excepción hecha de sus tejados que, metidos entre picachos de canteras calizas, semejaban gigantesca ostra marina. Era la playa un desierto erizado de peñascales y plagado de escollos, donde la mar hacía lo que se la antojaba, y lo que se la antojaba invariablemente era destruir. Casi de continuo rugía contra la ciudad, bramaba contra los farallones, embestía contra los peñascos que pretendían oponerse a su paso y los derribaba con estruendo. Respirábase en las casas un olor tan fuerte a pescado, que no parecía sino que los
es_second_half: habitantes de las aguas salían de éstas para curar en las casas sus enfermedades, de la misma manera que las personas enfermas suelen buscar la salud en los baños de mar. Algunos, muy pocos, se dedicaban a la pesca en aquellas aguas, y si durante el día la playa estaba siempre desierta, en cambio por la noche se veían personas que clavaban sus miradas inquietas en la inmensidad del mar. Comerciantes insignificantes a los que nunca se veía hacer un negocio, realizaban de pronto fortunas inmensas que no tenían explicación racional, y era muy de notar que nadie, por aquellos lugares, podía sufrir la presencia de una luz, de la que huían como del demonio.
tr_first_half: mr Lorry kahvaltısını bitirdiğinde deniz kıyısında gezintiye çıktı. Kargacık burgacık sokaklarıyla küçük Dover kasabası kıyıdan saklanmış, başını devekuşu gibi beyaz yamaca gömmüştü. Sahil, denizin kabaran dalgalarıyla taşların yuvarlanıp durduğu bir çölü andırıyordu ve deniz istediği şeyi yapıyordu, istediği de ortalığı yıkıp geçmekti. Sesi kasabada, yamaçta, her yerde gürlüyor, kıyıyı alt üst ediyordu. Evlerin etrafını öyle ağır bir balık kokusu sarmıştı ki, insan

Limanda az da olsa balıkçılık yapılıyordu ve akşamları, özellikle de sular yükselip etrafı su bastığında yürüyüş yapanlar ve denizi izleyenlerle epeyce hareketlenirdi ortalık. Fazla iş yapmayan küçük esnaf bazen –nasıl oluyorsa– büyük servetler elde ederdi ve o anlarda herkes fenercilerden uzak dururdu.

El señor Lorry, sin embargo, parecía haberse tranquilizado, y con una sonrisa en el rostro, comenzó a hablar de nuevo, esta vez sobre algo que parecía completamente diferente, pero que en realidad estaba relacionado con la historia que había contado la mujer, y que la había dejado con un sentimiento de inquietud y curiosidad. en_first_half: Madame Defarge, his wife, sat in the shop behind the counter as he came in. Madame Defarge was a stout woman of about his own age, with a watchful eye that seldom seemed to look at anything, a large hand heavily ringed, a steady face, strong features, and great composure of manner. There was a character about Madame Defarge, from which one might have predicated that she did not often make mistakes against herself in any of the reckonings over which she presided. Madame Defarge being sensitive to cold, was wrapped in fur, and had a quantity of bright shawl twined about her head,
en_second_half: though not to the concealment of her large earrings. Her knitting was before her, but she had laid it down to pick her teeth with a toothpick. Thus engaged, with her right elbow supported by her left hand, Madame Defarge said nothing when her lord came in, but coughed just one grain of cough. This, in combination with the lifting of her darkly defined eyebrows over her toothpick by the breadth of a line, suggested to her husband that he would do well to look round the shop among the customers, for any new customer who had dropped in while he stepped over the way.
en_results_raw: as she sat behind the counter, her eyes scanning the room with a calculating intensity that seemed to miss nothing. The fire crackled and spat in the hearth, casting flickering shadows on the walls as the chill of the winter evening seeped into the shop. Outside, the snow fell gently, casting a serene silence over the streets of Paris. But inside, the atmosphere was tense, the air thick with the weight of secrets and unspoken words. Madame Defarge's husband, Monsieur Defarge, stood at the counter, his eyes fixed on his wife as he waited for her to acknowledge his presence. He was a man of average height, with a rugged face and a sharp jawline, his dark hair flecked with grey at the temples. His eyes, a deep brown, seemed to hold a world of emotion, a depth that was both captivating and unnerving. As he waited, he seemed to be holding his breath, his entire being focused on the woman who sat behind the counter, her eyes still fixed on some point beyond him. The silence between them was palpable, heavy with anticipation, as if the very fate of the world hung in the balance. And then, without looking up, Madame Defarge spoke, her voice low and even, "What brings you here, Monsieur...?" Her eyes never left the point beyond him, her gaze seeming to bore into the very soul of the man who stood before her. The air seemed to vibrate with tension as the words hung in the air, waiting for a response, a response that would set in motion a chain of events that would change the course of history forever.

Chị Defarge toát ra vẻ gì đó khiến ta nghĩ rằng bà chủ này hiếm khi sai lầm trong những chuyện tính toán tiền nong. Era mujer de constitución robusta, aproximadamente de la edad misma que su marido, de ojos vigilantes, aunque muy contadas veces parecía mirar a ningún objeto determinado, grandes manos cubiertas de sortijas, cara de líneas enérgicas, expresión reservada y aire de perfecta compostura. Una de las características de la señora Defarge consistía en no sufrir nunca equivocaciones que redundasen en perjuicio de sus intereses en ninguna de las operaciones del establecimiento. Extremadamente sensible al frío, iba envuelta en pieles y abrigaba su cabeza con un chal de colores chillones que la cubría por completo, bien que dejando a la vista los grandes

Absorta en su ocupación, con el codo derecho apoyado sobre la mano izquierda, nada dijo la señora Defarge cuando su marido entró en el establecimiento, pero dejó oir una tosecita apenas perceptible. La tosecita, combinada con un ligero enarcamiento de sus cejas, negras como el ala del cuervo y perfectamente arqueadas, dió a entender a su marido la conveniencia de dar un vistazo a los clientes, entre los cuales acaso encontrase alguno nuevo que había llegado a la taberna mientras se encontraba en la calle.

en_results_raw: of a person is not aligned with their personal values, it can lead to feelings of guilt, anxiety, and self-doubt. This internal struggle can manifest in various ways, such as procrastination, absenteeism, or even sabotage. In extreme cases, it can result in a complete breakdown of the individual's mental health, leading to burnout and decreased productivity. Furthermore, when a person's business and personal values are not in sync, it can also affect their relationships with colleagues, clients, and loved ones, causing strain and tension in all areas of their life. This disconnection can be particularly challenging to overcome, as it requires a deep examination of one's motivations, goals, and priorities, and making significant changes to align their business and personal values. It is a delicate and often difficult process, but one that is essential for achieving a sense of purpose and fulfillment in both their professional and personal life.

en_first_half: Doctor Manette received such patients here as his old reputation, and its revival in the floating whispers of his story, brought him. His scientific

Some were suffering from the ravages of the plague, while others had been injured in the tumultuous events that had shaken the city in recent years. Despite the challenges he faced, Doctor Manette remained dedicated to his work, driven by a fierce determination to help those in need and to uncover the underlying causes of their suffering. His reputation as a brilliant and compassionate physician had preceded him, and he was met with a mixture of curiosity and trepidation by those who had heard of his work. As he went about his daily routine, examining patients and prescribing treatments, he was acutely aware of the weight of his responsibility, and the high stakes involved in his work. He knew that the lives of his patients hung in the balance, and he was determined to do everything in his power to ensure their recovery and well-being.

es_first_half: Recibía el doctor Manette en su casa a los enfermos que le traía su antigua reputación unida a las brisas flotantes de la historia dolorosa de su vida. Sus conocimientos científicos, su práctica
es_second_half: en el difícil ejercicio de su profesión y los experimentos ingeniosos a que se entregaba, diéronle una clientela muy envidiable y ganaba con creces lo necesario para cubrir las atenciones de la vida.
es_results_raw: eran ampliamente reconocidos en París, pero su fama se había extendido más allá de las fronteras de la ciudad, y muchos pacientes venían de provincias lejanas para buscar su ayuda. El doctor Manette, con su apariencia austera y su mirada profunda, escuchaba atentamente a cada uno de ellos, intentando comprender la causa de su sufrimiento, y con una compasión que parecía emanar de su alma, les ofrecía palabras de consuelo y esperanza. Su consultorio era un lugar de refugio para aquellos que se sentían abandonados y desamparados, y el doctor Manette era su ángel de la guarda, su guía en el laberinto de la enfermedad y la desesperanza. A medida que pasaban los días, su fama crecía, y su consultorio se convirtió en un lugar de peregrinaje para aquellos que buscaban la cura para sus males, pero el doctor Manette nunca se dejó llevar por la fama, siempre recordando que su verdadera misión era ayudar a los demás, y no buscar el reconocimiento personal. Su dedicación y su compasión eran la base de su éxito, y su legado perduraría en la memoria de la gente, como un ejemplo de la importancia de la empatía y la compasión en la práctica médica.

en_first_half: Although the Doctor’s daughter had known nothing of the country of her birth, she appeared to have innately derived from it that ability to make much of little means, which is one of its most useful and most agreeable characteristics. Simple as the furniture was, it was set off by so many little adornments, of no value but for their taste and fancy, that its effect was delightful. The disposition of everything in the rooms,
en_second_half: from the largest object to the least; the arrangement of colours, the elegant variety and contrast obtained by thrift in trifles, by delicate hands, clear eyes, and good sense; were at once so pleasant in themselves, and so expressive of their originator, that, as Mr. Lorry stood looking about him, the very chairs and tables seemed to ask him, with something of that peculiar expression which he knew so well by this time, whether he approved?
en_results_raw: The rooms were arranged with a sense of harmony and balance that was truly remarkable, considering the limited resources available. Every item, no matter how small, seemed to have been carefully chosen to contribute to the overall aesthetic, rather than simply being a necessary addition. The result was a space that felt warm and inviting, yet also elegant and refined. The Doctor's daughter had a natural talent for creating a sense of atmosphere, and it was clear that she had spent a great deal of time and thought in selecting each and every item that adorned the rooms. From the delicate patterns on the china to the vibrant colors of the fabrics, every detail seemed to have been carefully considered in order to create a sense of cohesion and visual appeal. As a result, the rooms felt like a true reflection of the Doctor's daughter's personality - warm, welcoming, and full of life. The sense of comfort and contentment that pervaded the space was palpable, and it was clear that the Doctor's daughter had created a true home, rather than simply a collection of rooms. The way in which she had managed to make the most of the limited resources available was truly impressive, and it was a testament to her resourcefulness and creativity. As one looked around the rooms, it was impossible not to feel a sense of admiration for the Doctor's daughter and her ability to turn a simple space into a true haven. The sense of pride and satisfaction that she must have felt in creating this space was evident, and it was clear that she had poured her heart and soul into every detail. The result was a space that was truly special, and one that would be remembered for a long time to come.

es_first_half: Aunque nada aprendió la hija del doctor en su patria de origen, es lo cierto que ésta la inició en aquella habilidad rara que consiste en hacer mucho con medios escasos, lo que constituía una de sus características más preciosas y agradables. Modesto y sencillo era el mobiliario de las habitaciones de la casa, y esto no obstante, algunas chucherías, que no tenían más valor real que el gusto exquisito con que estaban colocadas, daban a aquéllas un efecto delicioso.
es_second_half: La disposición de cuanto en la casa había, comenzando por el mueble más grande y acabando por el objeto más insignificante, la combinación de colores, y el contraste obtenido merced a nonadas por manos delicadas, ojos de mirada clara y sentidos de gusto irreprochable, ofrecían un conjunto tan agradable en sí y retrataban tan gráficamente a su autora, que no parecía sino que con mudo pero elocuente lenguaje preguntaban al señor Lorry, mientras extasiado los contemplaba, si merecían su aprobación.
es_results_raw: La casa, en fin, era un verdadero refugio de la soledad y el silencio, donde la joven podía encontrar un poco de paz y tranquilidad en medio de la vida bulliciosa de la ciudad. A pesar de su sencillez, cada objeto y cada detalle había sido cuidadosamente elegido por la doctora, y cada uno de ellos parecía contar una historia o evocar un recuerdo. La joven, que había crecido en un entorno más lujoso, no podía evitar sentir una mezcla de sorpresa y admiración por la capacidad de su madre para transformar un espacio vacío en un hogar acogedor. Y sin embargo, a medida que pasaba más tiempo en aquella casa, comenzó a darse cuenta de que había algo más detrás de la apariencia de sencillez y simplicidad que la rodeaba. La doctora, que había dedicado su vida a ayudar a los demás, parecía haber encontrado una forma de crear un hogar que fuera a la vez refugio y laboratorio, un lugar donde la creatividad y la imaginación podían florecer en cualquier momento. La joven comenzó a ver la casa de una manera diferente, como un lugar donde la vida y la muerte, la belleza y la fealdad, se encontraban en un delicado equilibrio, y donde cada objeto y cada detalle era un testimonio de la capacidad humana para crear belleza en el mundo.

As he watched her, he couldn't help but feel a pang of regret for the choices he had made, and the path he had chosen to follow, one that had led him to this moment, standing in the midst of a crowded Parisian street, lost in thought, and searching for a way to redeem himself, to make amends for past mistakes, and to find a sense of purpose in a world that seemed to have lost its way.

La búsqueda de un equilibrio entre la naturaleza y la tecnología ha sido un tema recurrente a lo largo de la historia. Desde la invención de herramientas para controlar el clima hasta la creación de ciudades sostenibles, hemos intentado encontrar una forma de coexistir con el entorno de manera armónica. Sin embargo, la realidad es que la humanidad sigue enfrentando desafíos ambientales cada vez más complejos, como la pérdida de biodiversidad, la contaminación del aire y el agua, y el cambio climático. En este contexto, la búsqueda de soluciones innovadoras y sostenibles se vuelve cada vez más urgente.

en_first_half: Sydney had been working double tides that night, and the night before, and the night before that, and a good many nights in succession, making a grand clearance among Mr. Stryver’s papers before the setting in of the
en_second_half: long vacation. The clearance was effected at last; the Stryver arrears were handsomely fetched up; everything was got rid of until November should come with its fogs atmospheric, and fogs legal, and bring grist to the mill again.
en_results_raw: the new clerk, a young man with a keen eye for detail, was due to arrive. The clock on the wall struck midnight, and Sydney, exhausted but satisfied with the progress he had made, decided to take a short break. He poured himself a cup of cold tea from the pot that had been sitting on the desk all day, and sat down in the worn leather armchair that had been his companion for countless late nights like this one. As he sipped his tea, he gazed out of the window at the dark, rain-soaked streets of London, the gas lamps casting a faint glow over the deserted pavement. The sound of the rain pattering against the windowpane was a soothing melody that seemed to wash away the fatigue that had been building up inside him all day. But as he sat there, lost in thought, he couldn't shake off the feeling that he was being watched. He turned back to his desk, his eyes scanning the room, but there was no one there. Shrugging it off as mere paranoia, he returned to his work, his mind already turning to the tasks that lay ahead. The new clerk's arrival would bring a welcome change, but Sydney knew that he still had a lot to do before then. He dived back into the papers, his fingers flying across the pages as he searched for any last-minute errors or discrepancies that might have slipped through the cracks. The hours ticked by, the only sound being the scratch of his pen on the paper and the occasional creak of the old wooden floorboards beneath his feet. As the first light of dawn began to creep into the room, Sydney finally finished his task, his eyes aching from the strain of the long night. He stood up, stretched his tired back, and began to tidy up the papers, his mind already turning to the new day ahead.

en_second_half: had to swallow, he got it down. “And now,” said Mr. Stryver, shaking his forensic forefinger at the Temple in general, when it was down, “my way out of this, is, to put you all in the wrong.”
en_results_raw: The barrister was keen enough to divine that the banker would not have gone so far in his expression of opinion on any less solid ground than moral certainty. Unprepared as he was for the large pill he had to swallow, he felt a sense of unease creeping up his spine as he pondered the weight of the words that had just been spoken. The banker's words had been laced with a conviction that was almost palpable, and the barrister couldn't help but wonder what had led him to such a firm stance. He thought back to their previous conversations, trying to recall any hint or suggestion that might have led to this dramatic turn of events. The banker's expression had been stern, almost unyielding, and the barrister knew that he had to tread carefully if he wanted to understand the reasoning behind his words. He decided to probe further, to see if he could uncover the underlying reasons behind the banker's conviction. "Tell me, sir," he said, his voice measured and calm, "what makes you so certain that this is the right course of action?" The banker's response was immediate, and the barrister could sense a hint of defensiveness in his tone. "I've seen it before," he said, his voice firm but with a hint of a tremble. "I've seen men like him, men who think they're above the law, who think they can do as they please without consequence. And I can tell you, it's a path that leads to ruin." es_results_raw: que la noticia de la muerte del rey había sido recibida con un silencio sepulcral en la ciudad, y que la gente, abrumada por la noticia, había permanecido en sus casas, sin atreverse a salir a la calle, como si temiera que la vida misma se hubiera detenido. Pero, en realidad, la vida seguía su curso normal, aunque con un tono de tristeza y de resignación, como si la muerte del monarca hubiera sido un golpe que había dejado a la ciudad sin aliento. El banquero, sin embargo, no se dejó llevar por la melancolía general, sino que, con su habitual pragmatismo, comenzó a pensar en las posibles consecuencias de la muerte del rey en la economía del país. Se preguntó si la sucesión sería pacífica, si habría algún descontento entre los nobles, y si la nueva monarca sería capaz de mantener la estabilidad y la prosperidad que había caracterizado el reinado del difunto. Mientras reflexionaba sobre estos temas, el banquero se dio cuenta de que la situación política del país estaba más volátil que nunca, y que cualquier movimiento en falso podría desencadenar una crisis que podría tener consecuencias devastadoras. Por eso, decidió tomar medidas para proteger sus intereses y asegurarse de que su banco no fuera afectado por la inestabilidad que se avecinaba.

In an unselfish aspect, I am sorry that the thing is dropped, because it would have been a bad thing for me in a worldly point of view; in a selfish aspect, I am glad that the thing has dropped, because it would have been a bad thing for me in a worldly point of view—it is hardly necessary to say I could have gained nothing
en_second_half: by it. There is no harm at all done. I have not proposed to the young lady, and, between ourselves, I am by no means certain, on reflection, that I ever should have committed myself to that extent. Mr. Lorry, you cannot control the mincing vanities and giddinesses of empty-headed girls; you must not expect to do it, or you will always be disappointed. Now, pray say no more about it. I tell you, I regret it on account of others, but I am satisfied on my own account. And when it is done, when the darkness has consumed all, I will be gone, and the world will be left to pick up the pieces. es_second_half: inocente el secreto más dulce de mi vida. Cuando el recuerdo de este día brote en mi memoria, ¿me será permitido abrigar la consoladora creencia de que ese corazón lo ha recogido y lo conserva, resuelto a no confiarlo a ningún otro?
es_results_raw: inocente como el suyo, mi secreto más oscuro, y espero que, al confiarle mi confesión, no me juzgue con la dureza que merezco. Sé que mi presencia en su vida ha sido un peso innecesario, un recordatorio constante de mis errores y fracasos. Pero, al mismo tiempo, he sentido que su bondad y compasión me han mantenido a flote en momentos en los que la desesperanza parecía ser mi única opción. Me duele admitirlo, pero soy un hombre sin esperanza, sin futuro, sin nada que ofrecer excepto mi arrepentimiento y mi gratitud por la amabilidad que me ha demostrado. Me gustaría poder decirle que todo ha sido una mera ilusión, que no soy tan malo como parece, pero la verdad es que soy un ser humano defectuoso, con defectos y debilidades que me han llevado a cometer errores y herir a los que amo. en_first_half: A suspended interest and a prevalent absence of mind, were perhaps observed by the spies who looked in at the wine-shop, as they looked in at every place, high and low, from the king’s palace to the criminal’s gaol. Games at cards languished,
en_second_half: players at dominoes musingly built towers with them, drinkers drew figures on the tables with spilt drops of wine, Madame Defarge herself picked out the pattern on her sleeve with her toothpick, and saw and heard something inaudible and invisible a long way off.
en_results_raw: The patrons grew restless, their faces illuminated only by the faint glow of candles and the soft murmur of conversation that seemed to be dying out. The proprietor, a stout man with a bushy mustache, polished a mug with a dirty rag, his eyes scanning the room with a mixture of boredom and desperation. Outside, the city was alive with the sounds of laughter and music, but in this small wine-shop, the atmosphere was heavy with an unspoken unease, a sense of foreboding that hung in the air like a challenge, waiting to be accepted or ignored. The spies, with their faces hidden behind masks of neutrality, continued their observations, their eyes darting from one patron to the next, searching for something, or someone, that might reveal the secrets they sought. The game of cards, once a lively and engaging spectacle, now lay abandoned, its players either gone or too engrossed in their own thoughts to care. The proprietor, sensing the tension, took a step back, his eyes fixed on the door, as if waiting for someone, or something, to walk in and shatter the silence that had settled over the room.

El dueño de la taberna, un hombre de edad avanzada con una barba gris y un bigote bien cuidado, se movía entre las mesas con una sonrisa forzada, intentando animar a los clientes con ofertas de bebidas especiales y platos calientes. Sin embargo, la atmósfera seguía siendo opresiva, como si la ausencia de alegría y la presencia de la sombra de la ley fueran demasiado pesadas para que nadie se atreviera a romper el silencio. Los clientes, la mayoría de ellos hombres de edad madura, bebían sus cervezas con lentitud, sus ojos fijos en el suelo, como si esperaran que algo, o alguien, apareciera para cambiar la situación. El tiempo pasaba lentamente, marcado solo por el sonido de los cubiertos golpeando los platos y el murmullo ocasional de una conversación en voz baja. La espera era agónica, y la impaciencia comenzaba a hacer mella en los nervios de los clientes, que empezaban a mirarse entre sí con una mezcla de ansiedad y desconfianza. El dueño de la taberna, notando la tensión en el ambiente, decidió tomar medidas para intentar mejorar la situación, y llamó a su única empleada, una joven con un rostro serio y una melena oscura, para que sirviera una ronda de bebidas y platos calientes a los clientes. La joven, con una sonrisa forzada, se movía entre las mesas con una bandeja llena de platos y bebidas, intentando animar a los clientes con su presencia, pero la atmósfera seguía siendo opresiva, y la espera parecía no tener fin.

Mientras el cliente saboreaba el coñac, la tabernera se acercó a él y le preguntó con curiosidad, "¿Qué es lo que te gusta tanto de este coñac? ¿Es la forma en que se elabora, la calidad de los ingredientes o algo más?" El cliente sonrió y comenzó a explicarle a la tabernera que el coñac le recordaba a su infancia, a sus abuelos y a las noches de invierno que pasaba con ellos alrededor del hogar, compartiendo historias y risas. La tabernera escuchó atentamente, con una sonrisa en el rostro, mientras que el cliente continuaba hablando, y por primera vez en mucho tiempo, se sintió conectada con alguien que compartía su pasión por la tradición y la historia detrás de cada trago. es_first_half: —Si mi contestación ha sido ligera, le ruego que me perdone—replicó Darnay. —Mi intención fué quitar toda la importancia a lo que, con no poca sorpresa mía, preocupa a usted demasiado. Le declaro, bajo mi palabra de honor, que hace mucho tiempo
es_second_half: que olvidé la conversación de la noche a que se refiere, y entiendo que al olvidarla, no contraje mérito alguno. Pues qué, ¿no me había prestado usted aquel mismo día un servicio de esos que ningún corazón medianamente agradecido puede ni debe olvidar?
es_results_raw: que no he tenido la menor intención de involucrarme en asuntos que no me incumben, y que mi presencia en París no ha sido más que un simple accidente, un viaje de negocios que se prolongó más de lo que yo hubiera deseado. Pero, como usted bien sabe, la vida es impredecible, y a veces los planes más bien trazados se ven alterados por circunstancias imprevistas. En este caso, mi llegada a París coincidió con la noticia de la muerte de mi tío, un hombre que, aunque no era rico, me había dejado en su testamento una pequeña herencia que, aunque no es nada importante, me ha permitido mantenerme en esta ciudad por un tiempo. Pero, como ya le dije, mi intención no es permanecer aquí, y mi objetivo es regresar a mi hogar lo antes posible, sin embargo, me he visto envuelto en una serie de acontecimientos que me han obligado a permanecer en París por más tiempo del que hubiera deseado. La verdad es que, aunque no lo creerá, me siento un poco atrapado en esta ciudad, rodeado de personas que parecen saber más de mí de lo que yo mismo sé. Me pregunto a menudo si no seré el objeto de algún juego, si no estaré siendo utilizado por alguien que busca sacar provecho de mi presencia en esta ciudad. As she gazed lovingly at Lucie's peaceful face, the young mother felt a sense of purpose and joy that she had never known before. The world might be full of uncertainty, but in this instant, she was certain of one thing: her love for her child would be a constant source of strength and comfort in the days to come. And so, she held Lucie close, feeling the warmth of her tiny body against her own, and let the gentle lullaby of her child's presence wash over her, calming her fears and soothing her worries. As the hours passed, the young mother felt a sense of contentment wash over her, a sense of peace that she had not known in a long time. She knew that she would face many challenges in the days ahead, but with Lucie by her side, she felt ready to face whatever came her way. El ambiente era tan sereno que hasta el tiempo parecía haberse detenido, dejando a la familia en un momento de perfecta armonía, como si el mundo exterior no existiera. en_results_raw: The cries of the prisoners echoed through the streets, mingling with the roar of the waves as they surged forward, a seemingly endless tide of humanity swept up in the chaos. The prison officers, battered and bruised, clung to whatever they could as they were carried along, their cries of "Stop! Stop!" lost in the cacophony of sound. The sea, it seemed, had become a force beyond human control, a raging torrent that threatened to engulf everything in its path. As the waves continued to roll in, the prisoners, a mix of desperate and defiant, clung to whatever they could find, their faces set against the wind and the waves. Some were screaming for help, others for their loved ones, while others simply screamed in terror, their voices lost in the howling gale. The prison walls, once a symbol of confinement and control, now stood as a fragile barrier against the fury of the sea, and it was clear that they would not hold for much longer. The sea was winning, and the prisoners were at its mercy. The officers, realizing the futility of their situation, were beginning to give up, their cries of despair mingling with the roar of the waves as they resigned themselves to their fate. The sea, it seemed, had become the ultimate judge, jury, and executioner, and the prisoners were about to face its wrath. The outcome was far from certain, but one thing was clear: the sea would not be silenced, and the prisoners would not be spared. The world was about to witness a spectacle unlike any other, a clash of human wills against the unyielding power of the ocean, and only time would tell who would emerge victorious.

Los prisioneros, que habían sido arrastrados por las olas, se encontraban ahora en medio de la confusión, intentando escapar de la multitud, pero la situación era cada vez más caótica, y parecía que nadie sabía qué hacer para restaurar el orden. en_first_half: Seven prisoners released, seven gory heads on pikes, the keys of the accursed fortress of the eight strong towers, some discovered letters and other memorials of prisoners of old time, long dead of broken hearts,—such, and such—like, the loudly echoing footsteps of Saint Antoine escort through the Paris streets in mid-July, one thousand
en_second_half: seven hundred and eighty-nine. Now, Heaven defeat the fancy of Lucie Darnay, and keep these feet far out of her life! For, they are headlong, mad, and dangerous; and in the years so long after the breaking of the cask at Defarge’s wine-shop door, they are not easily purified when once stained red.
en_results_raw: The year of our Lord, 1792. The city was alive with the fervor of revolution, the scent of blood and smoke hanging heavy in the air. The people of Paris, once divided by class and privilege, now marched together in a sea of red, their faces set with determination and their hearts ablaze with passion. The sound of drums echoed through the streets, a call to arms for the sans-culottes, the radical Jacobins, and the National Guard, all united in their quest for liberty, equality, and fraternity. The very foundations of the old regime were crumbling, and the people reveled in the chaos, their spirits high and their voices raised in defiance of the monarchy. The streets were a battleground, a testing ground for the ideals of the Enlightenment, and the fate of the French Revolution hung precariously in the balance. As the people marched, the ghosts of the past seemed to stir, the memories of the Bastille's fall and the royal family's flight from Versailles still fresh in their minds. The city was a cauldron of emotions, a maelstrom of hope and fear, and the outcome of this revolution was far from certain.

en_second_half: expressions of impatience were taken up, with marvellous quickness, at a distance: the more readily, because certain men who had by some wonderful exercise of agility climbed up the external architecture to look in from the windows, knew Madame Defarge well, and acted as a telegraph between her and the crowd outside the building.

Similarly, during two or three hours of drawl, and the winnowing of many bushels of words, Madame Defarge’s frequent glances at the guillotine, which stood in the centre of the square, seemed to be a reminder to the crowd of the fate that awaited those who would soon be brought before it. As the crowd's fervour grew, so did the fervour of the revolutionaries, who saw in this moment a turning point in their struggle for power. The air was thick with the smell of smoke and sweat, and the sound of drums echoed through the streets, beating out a rhythm that seemed to match the pounding of the crowd's hearts. The atmosphere was electric, and it seemed as if the very fabric of society was about to be torn apart. Madame Defarge, meanwhile, stood at the centre of it all, her eyes gleaming with a fierce intensity as she surveyed the scene before her. She was a woman consumed by a desire for revolution, and she would stop at nothing to see it through to its bitter end. As the crowd's cheers grew louder, she raised her arms, and the room fell silent, awaiting her next move. The moment of truth was at hand, and Madame Defarge was ready to seize it. The crowd, sensing that something was about to happen, grew even more agitated, their faces twisted with a mix of excitement and fear. The air was charged with anticipation, and it seemed as if the very fate of the revolution hung in the balance. And then, in a flash of inspiration, Madame Defarge spoke, her voice ringing out across the square, and the crowd erupted into cheers once more, this time with a ferocity that seemed to shake the very foundations of the city.

es_first_half: Como las gentes que estaban colocadas de espaldas de la señora Defarge se apresuraron a explicar a los que les seguían la causa de la satisfacción de aquélla, y la explicación cundió de oído en oído como reguero de pólvora, pronto sonaron aplausos ensordecedores en la sala, en la calle y en las plazas inmediatas. De la misma manera, todas las expresiones de impaciencia pronunciadas por la
es_second_half: señora Defarge durante dos o tres horas, fueron transmitidas con rapidez pasmosa a gran distancia. No es de admirar: hombres dotados de agilidad excepcional treparon por la fachada del edificio, aprovechando los adornos arquitectónicos que la cubrían, hasta encaramarse a los alféizares de las ventanas, desde donde veían y oían perfectamente a la señora Defarge y hacían oficio de telégrafo entre aquélla y el pueblo que rugía fuera.
es_results_raw: gentes que se encontraban en la multitud, se convirtieron en gritos de entusiasmo y de apoyo, mientras que los que estaban en la parte superior de la sala, comenzaron a agitar sus sombreros y sus pañuelos en señal de aprobación. La señora Defarge, con una sonrisa en su rostro, parecía estar disfrutando del momento, mientras que su esposo, Monsieur Defarge, permanecía serio y silencioso, observando la escena con una mirada crítica. La multitud, cada vez más emocionada, comenzó a cantar canciones revolucionarias y a corear consignas, mientras que los guardias de la prisión, que se encontraban en la entrada, parecían estar cada vez más nerviosos y ansiosos por la situación que se estaba desarrollando. La tensión en el aire era palpable, y se podía sentir que la multitud estaba a punto de estallar en una explosión de emoción y pasión. La señora Defarge, como si hubiera leído el pensamiento de la multitud, se dirigió hacia la parte delantera de la sala, donde se encontraba el juez que había condenado a la joven, y comenzó a hablar con él en voz alta, mientras que su esposo la miraba con una mirada de desaprobación. La multitud, cada vez más emocionada, comenzó a presionar hacia adelante, y los guardias de la prisión, con sus espadas en mano, se prepararon para contener a la multitud. La situación parecía estar a punto de desbocarse, y nadie sabía qué podría suceder a continuación.

en_first_half: A faint murmur arose about the house from the few people who were left there, and there was a saddling of a horse and riding away. There was spurring and splashing through the darkness, and bridle was drawn in the space by the village fountain, and the horse in a foam stood at Monsieur Gabelle’s door. “Help,
en_second_half: Gabelle! Help, every one!” The tocsin rang impatiently, but other help (if that were any) there was none. The mender of roads, and two hundred and fifty particular friends, stood with folded arms at the fountain, looking at the pillar of fire in the sky. “It must be forty feet high,” said they, grimly; and never moved.
en_results_raw: ...and I'll be hanged, I'll be hanged, I'll be hanged!" Monsieur Gabelle exclaimed, as he hastily opened the door and peered into the darkness. The horse, its breath misting in the chill air, stood motionless, its rider nowhere to be seen. The sound of the horse's hooves and the splashing water had awakened the entire household, and soon the door was flung open to reveal a figure, shrouded in shadows, who stumbled out into the courtyard. The figure, a young woman, clutched a small bag to her chest and gazed wildly about, as if searching for something or someone. She stumbled forward, her eyes fixed on Monsieur Gabelle, and he took a step back, his face pale with fear. "What is it, mademoiselle?" he stammered, his voice trembling. The woman's eyes locked onto his, and for a moment, they just stared at each other, the only sound the distant rumble of thunder and the creaking of the old wooden door. Then, in a voice barely above a whisper, she spoke the words that would change everything: "It's happening, Monsieur Gabelle. It's happening now." The words hung in the air, like a challenge, a warning, a portent of the chaos that was to come. The darkness seemed to grow thicker, more oppressive, as if it too was holding its breath, waiting for the storm to break. And in that moment, Monsieur Gabelle knew that his life, and the lives of those around him, would never be the same again.

en_second_half: glass. The general scarcity of everything, occasioned candles to be borrowed in a rather peremptory manner of Monsieur Gabelle; and in a moment of reluctance and hesitation on that functionary’s part, the mender of roads, once so submissive to authority, had remarked that carriages were good to make bonfires with, and that post-horses would roast.

As the rider continued on his way, the villagers emerged from their homes, their faces aglow with excitement and anticipation, and they gathered in small groups to talk and share stories of the day's events. The atmosphere was electric, and the sense of community and camaraderie was palpable. The rider, still unaware of the stir he had caused, rode on, but the villagers were already looking forward to the night ahead, filled with music, dance, and celebration, as they prepared to mark the beginning of the summer solstice, a time of renewal and rebirth, and a time to come together as a community to mark the longest day of the year.

La lectura de la carta le recordó a Darnay la carta que había recibido hacía unos meses, la que lo había alertado sobre la existencia de un peligro que lo acechaba en la sombra, y que ahora parecía haberse materializado en la forma de una amenaza real y tangible. El corazón de Darnay latía con fuerza mientras intentaba procesar la información que le había proporcionado la carta, y se preguntaba qué podría estar detrás de esta nueva amenaza que parecía estar cerrando el círculo de su vida. La incertidumbre y el miedo se apoderaron de él, y se sintió como si estuviera caminando en un laberinto sin salida, rodeado de peligros y sin saber qué camino tomar. La carta había desencadenado una tormenta de emociones en el pecho de Darnay, y ahora se sentía como si estuviera a punto de ser arrastrado por una marea de desesperanza y desesperación. es_second_half: había obrado de una manera imperfecta. es_results_raw: decidió que no podía seguir viviendo en aquella casa, donde cada rincón parecía recordarle la vergüenza y la deshonra que había traído sobre su familia. Así que, con un sentimiento de culpa y de remordimiento, comenzó a planificar su partida, sabiendo que no podría volver a ver a sus seres queridos sin sentir una gran tristeza y una profunda amargura. La idea de dejar atrás todo lo que había conocido y amado durante su vida era un pensamiento aterrador, pero sabía que era el único camino para poder empezar a reconstruir su vida y encontrar la paz interior que tanto anhelaba. La decisión no fue fácil, pero finalmente se decidió a tomar el primer paso hacia un nuevo comienzo, sin saber qué le esperaba, pero con la certeza de que debía intentarlo. La noche anterior a su partida, se sentó en su habitación, rodeado de sus pertenencias, y se preguntó qué sería de su vida en el futuro, si encontraría la felicidad y la tranquilidad que tanto deseaba, o si la oscuridad de su pasado lo perseguiría siempre. La incertidumbre lo consumía, pero sabía que no podía quedarse atrás, que debía seguir adelante, por más que le costara. Al día siguiente, con un corazón pesado y una mente confundida, se levantó de su cama y comenzó a prepararse para partir, sabiendo que su vida iba a cambiar para siempre.

en_first_half: A very few French leagues of his journey were accomplished, when Charles Darnay began to perceive that for him along these country roads there was no hope of return until he should have been declared a good citizen at Paris. Whatever might befall now, he must on to his journey’s end. Not a mean village closed upon him, not a common
en_second_half: barrier dropped across the road behind him, but he knew it to be another iron door in the series that was barred between him and England. The universal watchfulness so encompassed him, that if he had been taken in a net, or were being forwarded to his destination in a cage, he could not have felt his freedom more completely gone.
en_results_raw: the road ahead seemed to be fraught with peril, and yet he pressed on, driven by a sense of duty and a desire to prove himself worthy of the trust that had been placed in him. The farther he traveled, the more he became aware of the weight of his responsibilities, and the more he felt the need to succeed in his mission. He had been warned that the journey would be difficult, that the roads were treacherous and the people suspicious, but he had not been prepared for the extent of the danger that lay ahead. The sun was beginning to set, casting a golden glow over the landscape, and Charles knew that he had to find shelter for the night. He had been traveling for hours, and the thought of a warm fire and a comfortable bed was a tempting one. But he knew that he could not afford to rest, not yet. He had to keep moving, had to press on, no matter what the cost. The fate of his mission, and perhaps even his own life, hung in the balance, and he knew that he could not afford to falter. So he pushed on, his heart pounding in his chest, his senses on high alert, as he navigated the darkening landscape, searching for a place to rest and a chance to regroup. The darkness was gathering, and he knew that he had to find shelter soon, or risk being caught out in the open, exposed to the elements and the dangers that lurked within them. He quickened his pace, his eyes scanning the horizon for any sign of a village or a town, a place where he could find safety and security. And then, just as he was starting to lose hope, he saw it - a small village in the distance, its lights twinkling like stars in the fading light. He quickened his pace, his heart filled with a sense of relief and gratitude, as he made his way towards the village, hoping to find a place to rest and a chance to start anew.

Pero ya no podía retroceder; fuese la que fuese la suerte que el destino le tuviera deparada, no tenía más remedio que continuar el viaje hasta el final. A sus espaldas dejaba un
es_second_half: camino abierto, libre de barreras y de fosos, pero esto no obstante, sabía que entre Inglaterra y su persona se alzaban obstáculos mil veces más infranqueables que las más sólidas puertas de hierro. De tal suerte le rodeaba la vigilancia universal, que si hubiera viajado metido dentro de las mallas de espesa red de acero, o bien acondicionado en el interior de una jaula, no hubiese considerado su libertad más perdida.
es_results_raw: país que había sido testigo de su nacimiento, un país que había visto crecer a su madre, un país que había sido testigo de su infancia, pero que ahora parecía haberse convertido en un recuerdo lejano y irreconocible. La ciudad de París, con sus calles empedradas y sus edificios de piedra, se había convertido en un espejismo que se desvanecía a medida que se alejaba. Carlos Darnay se sentía como un extranjero en su propio país, un hombre sin hogar ni raíces, un viajero sin destino fijo. El viento frío y húmedo que soplaba desde el río Sena parecía reflejar su estado de ánimo, un viento que parecía llevar consigo el olor a humedad y desolación. A medida que caminaba, el paisaje se volvía cada vez más sombrío, como si la propia naturaleza estuviera reflejando su estado de ánimo. Los árboles, que habían sido tan verdes y vibrantes en verano, ahora parecían estar marchitándose, sus hojas amarilleando y cayendo al suelo como si fueran lágrimas de un mundo que se desmoronaba. Carlos Darnay se sentía como si estuviera caminando hacia la oscuridad, hacia un futuro incierto y lleno de incertidumbre. El ruido del tráfico y el bullicio de la ciudad parecían alejarse a medida que se adentraba en el bosque, dejándolo solo con sus pensamientos y sus miedos. El bosque, con sus árboles altos y sus ramas que se entrelazaban como si fueran dedos de una mano gigante, parecía estar observándolo, como si estuviera esperando a que se diera cuenta de algo que ya sabía desde hace mucho tiempo. Carlos Darnay se sentía como si estuviera siendo llevado hacia un destino que no podía evitar, un destino que parecía estar esperándolo desde siempre. Carlos Darnay se sentía como si estuviera a punto de descubrir algo, algo que cambiaría su vida para siempre. en_first_half: Naturally struck by the disagreeable word, Charles Darnay requested the speaker to take notice that he was a free traveller and French
en_second_half: citizen, in charge of an escort which the disturbed state of the country had imposed upon him, and which he had paid for.
en_results_raw: was not bound by any laws or customs of the land, and that he must be allowed to proceed on his journey without hindrance or molestation. The speaker, a stern-looking man with a thick beard, eyed him up and down before responding in a gruff tone, "I am not aware of any such laws or customs that would prevent you from passing through, Monsieur...?" he said, his voice dripping with a hint of skepticism. Charles Darnay's eyes narrowed slightly at the man's tone, but he stood his ground, his voice firm as he replied, "Darnay, sir. Charles Darnay. And I must insist that you allow me to continue on my way, as I have a pressing engagement in the next town." The speaker snorted, clearly unconvinced, but after a moment's hesitation, he stepped aside, allowing Charles to pass. As he walked away, he couldn't help but feel a sense of unease, as if he had just narrowly escaped a trap, and he quickened his pace, his eyes scanning the surrounding area for any signs of danger.

"Tôi là Monsieur Defarge," người đàn ông nói, "và tôi đang tìm kiếm một người đàn ông tên là Charles Darnay. Anh có phải là người đó không?" Charles Darnay cảm thấy một luồng không khí lạnh chạy qua người mình khi anh nhìn vào mắt của Monsieur Defarge, nhưng anh cố gắng giữ bình tĩnh và trả lời: "Đúng vậy, tôi là Charles Darnay." Monsieur Defarge nhìn anh một cách nghiêm ngặt, sau đó mỉm cười một cách không tự nhiên. "Tôi đã tìm thấy anh," anh nói, "và tôi cần phải nói chuyện với anh về một số vấn đề quan trọng."

en_first_half: He left escort and escorted without saying a word, however, and went into the guard-room; meanwhile, they sat upon their horses outside the gate. Looking about him while in this state of suspense, Charles Darnay observed that the gate was held by a mixed guard of soldiers and patriots, the latter far outnumbering the former; and that while ingress into the city for peasants’ carts bringing in supplies, and for similar traffic and traffickers, was easy enough, egress, even for the homeliest people,
en_second_half: was very difficult. A numerous medley of men and women, not to mention beasts and vehicles of various sorts, was waiting to issue forth; but, the previous identification was so strict, that they filtered through the barrier very slowly. Some of these people knew their turn for examination to be so far off, that they lay down on the ground to sleep or smoke, while others talked together, or loitered about. The red cap and tri-colour cockade were universal, both among men and women.

Carlos Darnay, mientras tanto, pudo observar que la guardia la formaban soldados y patriotas, más de estos últimos que de los primeros, y que, al paso que los carros que traían víveres a la ciudad, o los que a cualquier clase de tráfico se dedicaban, no tropezaban con dificultades de ningún género para entrar, en cambio los encontraban, y muy grandes, para salir, aun cuando se tratase de la gente más humilde. Hombres y mujeres, bestias de
es_second_half: carga y de tiro y carretas y coches de toda clase esperaban que se les permitiera salir; pero con tal rigidez se cumplía la ley sobre la identificación previa, que aunque a la barrera llegaban por cientos, la salida la hacían de uno en uno y por largos intervalos. Los que sabían que habría de pasar mucho tiempo antes que les llegase el turno, lo esperaban tendidos en la calle, donde dormían o fumaban, mientras otros entablaban animadas conversaciones o entretenían el tiempo paseando. Los gorros colorados y escarapelas tricolores eran prenda obligada que ostentaba todo el mundo, sin distinción de edades ni sexos.

Carlos Darnay, al observar este tráfico, se dio cuenta de que la situación era aún más tensa que lo que había imaginado, y que la ciudad estaba en un estado de sitio, con una guardia muy fuerte y muy vigilante. Mientras tanto, la escolta que había dejado a la puerta, se había reunido con el escoltado, y ambos habían entrado en el cuerpo de guardia, sin que nadie les hubiera impedido su paso. Carlos Darnay se preguntó qué podría estar pasando en la ciudad, y qué podría ser la causa de esta situación tan extraña y alarmante. Se acercó a uno de los soldados que estaba a la puerta, y le preguntó qué pasaba, pero el soldado, sin responderle, lo miró con una expresión de miedo y desconfianza, y se alejó rápidamente. Carlos Darnay se dio cuenta de que no iba a poder obtener ninguna información de los soldados, y decidió intentar hablar con uno de los patriotas que estaban en la guardia. Se acercó a uno de ellos, que estaba charlando con un grupo de personas, y le preguntó qué pasaba en la ciudad. El patriota, que parecía ser un hombre de edad avanzada, lo miró con curiosidad, y le respondió que la ciudad estaba en un estado de sitio, debido a la presencia de un enemigo que había intentado invadir la ciudad, y que la guardia había sido reforzada para protegerla. en_first_half: So strangely clouded were these refinements by the prison manners and gloom, so spectral did they become in the inappropriate squalor and misery through which they were seen, that Charles Darnay seemed to stand in a company of the dead. Ghosts all! The ghost of beauty, the ghost of
en_second_half: stateliness, the ghost of elegance, the ghost of pride, the ghost of frivolity, the ghost of wit, the ghost of youth, the ghost of age, all waiting their dismissal from the desolate shore, all turning on him eyes that were changed by the death they had died in coming there.
en_results_raw: beauty, the ghost of youth, the ghost of joy, the ghost of life itself, all seemed to have been extinguished by the cruel hand of fate, leaving behind only a faint and flickering flame that struggled to stay alight in the darkness. The faces of the women, once radiant and full of hope, now seemed to be shrouded in a mist of despair, their eyes sunken and their skin pale, like the moon on a cloudy night. The men, once strong and proud, now appeared worn and weary, their eyes cast downward in defeat, their shoulders slumped in resignation. The very air itself seemed heavy with the weight of their sorrow, and the sound of their whispers seemed to carry on the wind, a mournful sigh that echoed through the desolate landscape. The prison, once a place of confinement, had become a place of spiritual death, where the very essence of life had been drained from the souls of those who dwelled within its walls. And Charles Darnay, a man of noble birth and breeding, seemed to be a stranger in this strange and forsaken land, a man out of place and time, a man who had stumbled into a world that was no longer his own. He walked among the ghosts, a ghost himself, a specter of a man who had lost his way in a world that had lost its heart, and he seemed to be searching for a way out, a way back to the world he once knew, a world of beauty and joy, a world of life and hope.

en_first_half: The shadow attendant on Madame Defarge and her party seemed to fall so threatening and dark on the child, that her mother instinctively kneeled on the ground beside her,
en_second_half: and held her to her breast. The shadow attendant on Madame Defarge and her party seemed then to fall, threatening and dark, on both the mother and the child.
en_results_raw: and grasped her hand in hers, as if to shield her from the ominous presence that seemed to emanate from the mysterious woman. The child's eyes, wide with a mix of fear and curiosity, were fixed intently on Madame Defarge, who stood tall and imposing, her piercing gaze scanning the crowd with an air of superiority. The atmosphere was tense, heavy with an unspoken understanding that this was a woman not to be trifled with, and the crowd parted slightly as she moved through it, her dark figure casting long shadows on the cobblestones. The mother's grip on her child's hand tightened, her knuckles white with anxiety, as she whispered a soft warning in her ear, "Don't look, ma chère, don't look at her." But the child's eyes remained fixed, transfixed by the enigmatic figure of Madame Defarge, who seemed to be watching her with an unnerving intensity, as if sizing her up, weighing her worth, and finding her wanting.

Chị ta bước ra trước để đối mặt với những người đàn ông này, giọng nói của chị rung rinh và đầy quyết tâm. Người đàn ông lớn tuổi nhìn chị Defarge với sự ngạc nhiên và một chút sợ hãi, nhưng chị Defarge không để ý đến điều đó. La señora Defarge, con su rostro serio y su mirada fija, parecía estar observando la escena con una intensidad que rayaba en la obsesión, mientras que sus compañeros se mantenían a una distancia prudente, como si no quisieran ser parte de la escena. El aire estaba cargado de una tensión que parecía a punto de estallar en cualquier momento, y la pobre madre, con su hijo en sus brazos, parecía estar a punto de perder la razón ante la presencia de la sombra amenazadora.

en_first_half: This was the Carmagnole. As it passed, leaving Lucie frightened and bewildered in the doorway of the wood-sawyer’s
en_second_half: house, the feathery snow fell as quietly and lay as white and soft, as if it had never been.
en_results_raw: shed, she stumbled backward, her eyes fixed on the retreating figure of the mysterious stranger, who had vanished into the dense forest, leaving behind only the faint scent of smoke and the echoes of the Carmagnole's haunting melody. The sound of the distant sawmill's rhythmic creaking and the chirping of birds in the trees seemed to mock her, as if trying to drown out the unsettling feeling that she had just witnessed something inexplicable. The wood-sawyer, a gruff but kind old man, emerged from his workshop, his bushy eyebrows furrowed in concern as he took in Lucie's pale face and wide eyes. "What's wrong, child?" he asked, his voice low and soothing, but Lucie just shook her head, unable to find the words to describe the strange and disquieting encounter she had just experienced.

The Doctor, resplendent in his long, black coat, tipped his hat in response, his eyes locked onto hers with a hint of a smile, as if he knew a secret that only he and she shared. The sound of the wind rustling through the snowflakes was the only sound that broke the silence between them, a reminder that even in the midst of revolution, there was still beauty to be found in the simple, everyday moments.

en_first_half: The passage to the Conciergerie was short and dark; the night in its vermin-haunted cells was long and cold. Next day, fifteen prisoners were put
en_second_half: to the bar before Charles Darnay’s name was called. All the fifteen were condemned, and the trials of the whole occupied an hour and a half.
en_results_raw: The prisoners were led to the courtyard, where they were forced to strip and hand over their belongings to the guards. The cold stone floor beneath their bare feet was a harsh welcome to the unforgiving world of the Conciergerie. The prisoners were then divided into groups, some to be taken to the interrogation chambers, while others were led to the damp, dimly lit cells where they would spend the next few days, or perhaps weeks, in darkness and solitude. The air was thick with the stench of mold and decay, and the sound of dripping water echoed through the corridors, a constant reminder of the bleak fate that awaited them. As they walked, the prisoners caught glimpses of their fellow inmates, their faces gaunt and haunted, their eyes sunken from the lack of light and the weight of their circumstances. The atmosphere was heavy with despair, and the very walls seemed to press in on them, suffocating them with their oppressive weight.

es_first_half: Breve y obscuro era el paso desde La Force a la Conserjería, largas y frías las noches pasadas en las pestilentes celdas de la última. Quince prisioneros comparecieron ante
es_second_half: el Tribunal a la mañana siguiente, antes que fuera llamado a comparecer Carlos Darnay. Las vistas de los quince duraron hora y media, y los quince fueron condenados a muerte.
es_results_raw: el juez, un hombre de edad avanzada con una mirada severa y un bigote gris, que les preguntó con una voz ronca y desagradable sobre sus supuestas actividades subversivas. El ambiente era tenso y cargado de miedo, y los prisioneros se miraban entre sí con una mezcla de ansiedad y desesperanza. El juez les recordó que la traición era un delito grave y que la pena máxima era la muerte, lo que provocó un murmullo de miedo entre los prisioneros. El juez les dio la oportunidad de defenderse, pero sabían que era una oportunidad escasa, ya que la decisión ya estaba tomada. El juez les preguntó a los prisioneros sobre sus contactos y actividades, y ellos respondieron con evasivas y mentiras, intentando ocultar su verdadera identidad y propósito. El juez les escuchó con atención, anotando en un papel las respuestas de los prisioneros, y luego les dio la oportunidad de hacer preguntas, pero ellos se limitaron a pedir clemencia y libertad, sin esperanza de obtenerla. El juez les dio la sentencia, condenándolos a muerte, y los prisioneros se derrumbaron en el suelo, llorando y gritando de rabia y desesperanza. El juez salió de la sala, dejando a los prisioneros a su suerte, y los guardias entraron para llevarlos a sus celdas, donde pasarían las últimas horas de su vida antes de ser ejecutados.

The air was heavy with an unspoken tension, and the silence was oppressive, weighing heavily on the shoulders of the two figures standing in the doorway. The sound of the clock ticking away in the corner of the room was the only sound that broke the stillness, a steady heartbeat that seemed to pulse in time with the racing of Doctor Manette's heart. His daughter, Lucie, stood beside him, her eyes fixed on his face, her expression a mixture of concern and fear. She had seen her father like this before, but never for so long, and she didn't know what to make of it. The door, which had been ajar just moments before, now creaked softly in the draft from the hallway, as if it too was trying to get a glimpse of the scene unfolding before it. The lamp, still held tightly in Doctor Manette's hand, cast eerie shadows on the walls, making it seem as though the very darkness itself was alive and watching them.

La habitación estaba tranquila, la luz del sol entraba a través de la ventana, pero él no se sentía en paz. Se levantó de la cama y se dirigió hacia la ventana, mirando hacia la calle, intentando encontrar alguna pista de lo que había pasado. La gente caminaba por la calle, sin saber que él estaba allí, sin saber que algo había cambiado en su vida. Se sintió solo, abandonado, y no sabía qué hacer para encontrar la paz que había perdido. La ciudad parecía estar viva, pero él se sentía muerto, como si hubiera perdido su conexión con el mundo. Se preguntó si había sido un sueño, si había sido una pesadilla, pero sabía que no era así. Sabía que algo había cambiado, que algo había sido arrancado de su vida, y no sabía cómo recuperarlo. Se quedó allí, mirando hacia la calle, sintiendo la soledad y la desolación, sin saber qué hacer para encontrar la paz que había perdido.

The dim light in the hallway seems to amplify the silence, making every creak of the floorboards sound like a warning sign. I take a deep breath and try to focus on the task at hand, but my mind keeps wandering back to the possibility of being overheard. The more I think about it, the more I become convinced that I need to find a way to clear my head and come up with a solid plan. But for now, I'm stuck in limbo, unsure of what to do next, and that's a frustrating feeling that I'm not used to. I try to recall the layout of the house, thinking that maybe I can find a way to sneak into the room without being seen, but my memory is hazy and I'm not sure if I'll be able to remember everything correctly. The uncertainty is eating away at me, making my stomach twist with anxiety. I take another deep breath and try to calm myself down, but my heart is racing and my palms are sweating. I know I need to stay focused if I want to get out of this situation unscathed, but it's hard to think clearly when my mind is clouded with doubt.
